intro: Gomphocarpus ovatus, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a star-like appearance. The plant has a hairy stem and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when mature and turn brown as they dry. Gomphocarpus ovatus is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
